Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks are hoping to halt their longest losing streak in four seasons.
Dallas is 1-5 since losing superstar Luka Doncic on Christmas Day with a left calf strain.
The Mavericks will more than likely have to rely on Klay Thompson (14.2 points per game) and P.J. Washington (12.8) to pull them through this rough stretch.
It feels like we're losing a guy each day, so it's a next-man-up mentality,
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas, playing Los Angeles for the first time this season, has won seven of nine against the Lakers since March 2022.
Anthony Davis collected 30 points and 13 rebounds to increase his team-leading averages to 26.0 points and 11.8 boards per contest.
LeBron James adds 24.0 points per game for the Lakers, followed by Austin Reaves' 18.4.
Others: The Lakers had won seven of nine games before Sunday's 119-115 loss in Houston against the Rockets.
Los Angeles trailed by as many as 22 points and played from behind from the 3:49 mark of the first quarter.
The Mavericks will travel to Los Angeles on Feb. 25 before hosting the Lakers again on April 9.
Kyrie Irving will be sidelined at least a week with a bulging disk in his back.
Daniel Gafford (11.7 points, 6.0 rebounds per game) sprained his left ankle and left the game after playing eight minutes.
